assessments.status_rationale: Today’s coverage highlights escalating U.S.-Venezuela tensions and discussion of a potential U.S. “blockade”/maritime pressure (e.g., Venezuelan Navy escorts in defiance of threats), but does not cite an official U.S. government notice (press release or Federal Register) issuing new enforcement guidance/interdiction authority/expanded sanctions specifically targeting Venezuelan oil maritime shipments.

No item in today’s bullets reports a major marine insurer or top-tier tanker operator publicly announcing suspension/restriction of coverage or carriage for Venezuela-related voyages due to U.S. enforcement risk.
Today’s news bullets do not provide NYMEX WTI front-month settlement data, and there is no explicit report that WTI settled at or below $60 on any trading day.
No bullet indicates a U.S. federal court issued a TRO or preliminary injunction pausing enforcement of expanded U.S. travel restrictions affecting newly added countries.
The Tesla-related item concerns EV sales/market dynamics, not a confirmed change to consumer-facing Autopilot/FSD marketing language removing or qualifying claims cited in the California ruling.
There is no report in today’s bullets that Waymo confirmed closing a new external funding round with disclosed proceeds of at least $10B.
Today’s bullets do not mention Databricks publicly filing an S-1 or publicly acknowledging confidential submission of a draft registration statement for a U.S. IPO.
No bullet references the DEA publishing a final rule in the Federal Register rescheduling marijuana to Schedule III.
This prediction concerns the February 2026 unemployment rate print; today’s news does not include (and cannot yet include) that release.
This prediction concerns an action at the March 2026 FOMC meeting; today’s bullets do not provide evidence about that future decision.
